intro: Geanthus trichanthera, commonly known as the hairy stem geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves are distinctive botanical features. It produces small, red or purple berries that are an important food source for wildlife.
